page.title: 19ECOLOGY WALDEN LANE RESERVE
page.content: This area of West Grimstead is a particularly good one for wild life, and could almost be called Grimstead's nature reserve.There are three dwelling's.Walden farm, owned by the Dawsons,has 27 acres,used for grazing sheep and cattle.The bailiff's Cottage is owned by the Austrengs.They have half an acre,which is garden.The Keepers house has 4 acres of hay and half an acre of garden ,which is owned by the Parrys.Within the last year the following animals have been seen quite regularly;smooth snakes,grass snakes,adders,slow_worms,mice,rats,and water rodents,squirrels,several species of lizard and kestrels,barn owls and sparrowhawks. A pair of harriers have also been spotted.
